author: s1na
content:
Regarding EIP-7742, it says in the spec:
> The Engine API is extended to provide both the target_blobs_per_block and the max_blobs_per_block when the CL requests the EL to construct a payload for proposal.

I feel like the max_blobs_per_block there is unnecessary and can be removed since it is not being validated by EL anyway. Or am I missing something?

author: jtraglia
content:
There was a discussion about this on github. I thought the conclusion was that sending `max_blobs_per_block` to EngineAPI's `new_payload` is redundant.
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3800#discussion_r1670341560

author: jtraglia
content:
To be clear, the CL provides both `target_blobs_per_block` and `max_blobs_per_block` to the EL via `PayloadAttributes` here:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/validator.md#execution-payload
